snippet: A federal indictment says Mr. Burke, who resigned two months ago, faces charges of civil rights violations and obstructing a civil rights investigation.
abstract: Former Suffolk County Police Chief James Burke is arrested on federal charges of violating suspect Christopher Loeb's civil rights and obstructing investigation into matter; Burke resigned due to federal investigation of incident, in which he is alleged to have beaten Loeb up in interrogation room and attempted to cover it up.
lead_paragraph: A federal indictment says Mr. Burke, who resigned two months ago, faces charges of civil rights violations and obstructing a civil rights investigation.

headline.main: Ex-Police Chief of Suffolk County Is Accused of Beating Man and Trying to Cover It Up
headline.print_headline: Ex-Suffolk Police Chief Accused of Beating Man and Pressing His Fellow Officers to Lie About It
